The dress's fit and flare silhouette made me feel like I had stepped right out of a retro fashion magazine. As the afternoon turned into evening, I found myself twirling around the room, feeling like a true vintage fashion icon. The memories made in that dress will always hold a special place in my heart. This was truly the talk of the event and my Sorors were quite impressed.  Sidebar: my dress color was Royal Blue 😉and it was fit for a royal.

Very Pleased...priced right and it has pockets too!

I love the flowers on the top. The fit was good. The main fabric feels a little cheap. Which considering what I paid for it is not surprising. I’m a size 8, 5’7” my weight is 142 lbs Length is great.

It's a bad dress. The fabric of the main dress is opaque so I don't have to wear a slip, and the dress has pockets, so bonus points for that. However, the pockets are small and can barely hold my phone  The embroidery on the top panel is *itchy*. I could take it to a seamstress and get it lined with a fabric that matches my skin tone, but that would probably cost as much as, if not more than, the dress itself. So I guess I get to deal with the itchy embroidery  Speaking of the mesh panel at the top: it tore in multiple spots after maybe 4 washes and I followed the washing instructions exactly. I am not impressed  Another problem is that the tie wasn't sewn evenly when it was put on the neckline, so I have barely enough fabric on one side to tie a bow in the back, and an extra 9 or 10 inches on the other side that hangs awkwardly from the tail of the bow. Not really a great look  I'm busty, so I had to size up, but the waistline still doesn't hit my waist; it's about 3" higher so it makes my waist look wider than it is. The dress is supposed to be A-line but the way it lays, it looks like I'm going for an empire waist. If I had sized up any more than I did, I would have been swimming in the dress, though  0/10 would buy again. It'd be nice if I could get my money back, to be honest
